intro: Dianthera spicata, commonly known as the spike dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Dianthera spicata is often found in moist, shady habitats such as forests and woodlands.
